intro: Cryptantha leiocarpa var. eremocaryoides, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. This variety is distinguished by its more compact form compared to the typical variety of Cryptantha leiocarpa.
